descripcion: Development and support for internal use applications in my internship at ExxonMobil, inside the Modern Application Development team. The supported apps include NextPlan (used by development planners), DVT (used by data stewards to find issues in massive data sets), SACS (used by security officials in unconventional exploration wells to create and manage alerts), among others. Creation and addition of endpoints in APIs, integration with Microsoft Azure and GitHub, periodic code testing for the different applications.
mejoras: For each Program Increment the team objectives are determined through the Agile/SCRUM methodology, dividing the tasks in the different sprints that are part of the increment, keeping track of what was completed in each time frame.

descripcion: Websites for the degree of Civil Engineering at the UTN FRBA, with the goal of incorporating concepts from subjects like Geotechnics (by using a website to sort out soil by SUCS and AASHTO systems, estimate liquid limit and plastic limit of a soil), and Concrete Technology (through True or False module and calculation for concrete dosage). The pages were developed using basic elements from React and Bootstrap, not paying a lot of attention to the design, since they are only used by a small group of students and not launched to the general public.
mejoras: Create more websites to automate engineering processes, incorporate new functionalities and make code easier and more accessible so it can be reused in different tasks.

descripcion: Designed the e-commerce website for the Helplab store, with pages showcasing the different products that are sold in the shop, such as headphones, smart watches, speakers, keyboards, mouse, chargers and other products. The store has different products with pictures, descriptions, division in categories, tags and more. Other features included are contact information, the possibility to order, filter or search products, configure payment methods and more.

Adaptación del popular juego Wordle en español, permitiendo el input del usuario de forma manual o a través del teclado. La mecánica es la misma que la del juego original, con las letras introduciéndose a medida que el usuario tipea, y luego actualizando sus colores a amarillo o verde según si la letra está o no en la palabra y su posición. Las letras no utilizadas se ocultan en el teclado, al igual que en el juego. Se pueden compartir los resultados copiándolos al portapapeles.
mejoras: Actualizar el juego para incorporar palabras de más letras, palabras con tildes, etc. Mejorar el sistema que permite ocultar las letras en el teclado. Incorporar modo claro y opción para jugar una sola vez por día.

descripcion: This website was created from scratch due to my requirement of having a place to show my web development projects. I used multiple visual tools and resources to create a nice page, with a simple design which shows my personal information in a clear, orderly and fun way. I learned how to use components from many different sources, such as tsParticles, progress bar elements, text gradients with CSS, automatic counters with JS and many Bootstrap components including Modals, Carrousels and Tooltips. This website is also 100% responsive, so it can be visited from different devices without any issues. The page has 4 sections: a visually attractive Home, which invites visitors to continue browsing, an About Me section with personal information and stats about my performance, a Portfolio section where I showcase my projects and a Contact section where my Resume and Cover Letter can be downloaded, and comments and suggestions can be sent to me.
mejoras: Add light mode, English and Spanish sections, keep improving the page to make it more visually attractive and expand my portfolio.

descripcion: This page was created for the final project from the .NET Developer course from Becas NEORIS together with UTN FRBA. This page was presented to the Engineers Roxana Leituz and Pablo Mendez, Systems Engineering teachers, who approved it due to the good work performed in the frontend and the backend. In my workgroup of 2 people, my partner handled the view of the travel system, while I handled the functionalities of the system. Clients, packages and bills can be loaded into the system, which then can be edited, deleted or seen more in detail. There are features which allow to list customers who fulfill certain conditions (such as clients which at least two packages sold, for example), or to see the number and total amount of a customer's trips. All of this data is stored in a database through SQL.

Copy of the digital screen that appears on the popular TV show 100 Argentinos Dicen/Family Feud. A question is asked and up to 8 answers are shown, in order from most popular to least popular. Two teams compete to see who can collect the most points by guessing the most right answers. They have up to 3 attempts (crosses) to get all the options. Controls: Space bar (buzzer sound), Enter (reveal the question), 1 to 8 (reveals the answer with the respective number), Right arrow (go to the next question), Any other key (add a cross). At the end of the show, two of the contestants from the winning team face the Fast Money. In this round, 5 questions are asked, and the most popular answers to each question must be guessed by the players. One of the players answers first, they must answer in 20 seconds. Then, the other player answers in 25 seconds, but they cannot repeat any of the options which were already said by the other player. If on this round 200 points are reached, the game is won.
mejoras: Configure easily uploadable and editable questions and options, add the names of the two competing teams and the score of each team.

descripcion: An online version of the popular game Hasta Donde Puedas/Cards Against Humanity. A black card is picked randomly and 10 white cards are dealt to each player. Taking turns, the players must choose the white card that they think completes the prompt from the black card the best. Afterwards, all players vote for the card they think was the funniest, and the winner gets a point. The first player to get to 5 points wins. Controls: Drag and drop over the cards with the mouse, then at the vote click on the chosen card. Numbers from 1 to 0 to pick the card with the respective index during the game, then numbers from 1 to the amount of players to pick the respective card during the vote. Possibility to activate auto mode (plays and votes automatically in each round), shuffle cards up to 3 times per game, activate light or dark mode, change game options.
mejoras: Add rooms, improve the overall look of the game, allow different packs and extensions that come with the real game.

descripcion: This website was created for the ophtalmology company QWQ Latino América LLC. It is a basic page with information about the ophtalmology products HD Analyzer and Tear Film Analyzer, and their respective brochures and characteristics. It also has a Contact section with a form which sends comments directly to the people in charge of customer service for the company. The site is 100% responsive, it can be seen without issues through mobile devices. Unfortunately, the hosting for this website was discontinued, so it is not posible to visit it. What is in the photos is all the information I was able to recollect about the page. However, it was the first project of mine in which I had contact with a client, and I made sure to hear and acknowledge their requests in order to have an attractive and informative page.

This website was created for a project from the Marketing subject at my high school. It is a fairly basic website since at that moment I only knew HTML, CSS and JavaScript on a basic level. The website was 100% responsive through Bootstrap, so it could be seen from any device. In my group consisting of 2 people, my partner handled the logo design in different hues and color schemes, which were visible in the Home section, and I coded the entirety of the website. We took into account every suggestion from the teacher, treating them as observations from a client and asking for all the information needed to improve the site.Unfortunately, the hosting for this website was discontinued, so it is not posible to visit it. What is in the photos is all the information I was able to recollect about the page. However, it was my first proyect and I learned a lot.
